title: Summer Walker surprised by ex-boyfriend on-stage days after split
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Summer Walker may not be single after all as she was surprised on-stage by her ex-boyfriend, London On Da Track, just hours after announcing their split – and it looks as though he was able to win her back.

The Girls Need Love singer brought her tour to London’s Troxy on Tuesday night in celebration of her critically-acclaimed debut album, Over It.

It came just hours after Summer, 23, revealed she and London On Da Track had split just two months after going public with their relationship.

London, real name London Tyler Holmes, is responsible for producing her hit album, which peaked at number two on the US Billboard 200 chart earlier this month.

But it seems he wasn’t ready to let his leading lady go and decided to surprise her on-stage – in London which couldn’t have been more appropriate.

In footage shared on Summer’s Instagram page, London is seen jumping onto the stage armed with a huge teddy bear and a single rose.

The 28-year-old producer then reached out to kiss Summer’s hand before they share an actual kiss and a cuddle.

Summer was clearly overwhelmed with the bold gesture and flashed the audience the peace sign to confirm their reunion.

We’re getting serious flashbacks to when Offset surprised Cardi B on-stage earlier this year, only this incident had an immediate happy ending and London was not escorted off stage by security.

Fans were devastated when Summer confirmed her split from the acclaimed producer with a message on her Instagram stories on Monday.

The pair was thought to have been a solid couple and London often posted loved-up pictures with the musician.

‘Single. Lol somehow I always end up with male chauvinist,’ she explained. ‘Im a alpha female so I guess when I think for myself/make my own decisions it’s taken as disrespect. That was cute tho. God bless him still a sweet man deep down inside [sic].’

Sharing his happiness to have won his woman back, London wrote in an Instagram post: ‘I’ll run bak to you before I let U walk away slime Love [sic].’

Summer is currently enjoying a successful run with her new album Over It, which has become the biggest week for an R&B album by a female artist in over three weeks with 134,000 equivalent units sold in the week ending 10 October.
